_comment: Configuration file for Pico2W tracked arm car control system

i2c._comment: I2C bus configuration for PCA9685 servo controller

servos._comment: Joint 1 - Base joint of mechanical arm
servos.name: 机械臂关节1

servos._comment: Joint 2 - Middle joint of mechanical arm
servos.name: 机械臂关节2

tracks._comment: TB6612FNG dual motor driver for differential steering tracks

base_rotation._comment: DRV8837 single motor driver for platform rotation

speed_presets._comment: Speed presets for track control (0-100 percentage)

safety._comment: Safety timeout settings to prevent runaway motors
safety._timeout_description: Motors auto-stop if no command received for this duration
safety._sleep_description: Base rotation motor enters sleep mode after this idle duration

_notes: Pulse widths are in microseconds (typically 500-2500 for standard servos)
Initial angles must be within min_angle and max_angle range
Pin names use CircuitPython board module format (e.g., 'GP0', 'GP1')

_hardware_requirements.power: Separate power supplies recommended for motors and Pico

_configuration_guide.step2: Update wifi.ssid and wifi.password with your network credentials
_configuration_guide.step3: Adjust servo angle limits based on your mechanical arm constraints
_configuration_guide.step4: Verify pin assignments match your hardware wiring
_configuration_guide.step5: Test servos individually to ensure min/max angles prevent collisions
_configuration_guide.step6: Upload to Pico and rename to config.json in root directory
